member.name: M:ATT_MSSDK.RequestFactory.GetMessageDelta(System.String)
member.summary: This method provides capability to check for updates by passing in a client state. This is typically used when a client goes from being offline to becoming online. If the subscriber’s mailbox index cache does not exist an error (MESSAGES.MESSAGES-4019) would be returned to the client and the client would have to re-initialize the cache by calling CreateMessageIndex method.
member.param: The state of the client which was obtained from a either the Get Message Index request, or from the Get Message List request.

member.name: M:ATT_MSSDK.RequestFactory.GetNotificationConnectionDetails(System.String)
member.summary: This method provides capability to retrieve details about the credentials, endpoint and resource information to setup a notification connection. This method needs to be invoked before a STOMP a connection is established to subscribe for notifications. The user credentials provided in the response is valid for a period of 30 seconds and STOMP connection needs to be established within this period. If the credentials expire, this method would needs to be invoked again.
member.param: The name of the resource the client is interested in subscribing for notifications. Currently supported resource is TEXT – Subscription to this resource will provide notification related to messages stored as TEXT in the cloud inbox. MMS – Subscription to this resource will provide notification related to messages stored as MMS in the cloud inbox.

member.summary: This method converts text to synthesized voice.
member.param: Text to be converted to speech audio. Must be of type specified in the Content-Type header.
Must be defined as one of the following values: text/plain and application/ssml+xml
May be defined as one of the following values: ‘en-US’ – US English ‘es-US’ – US Spanish Default value is ‘en-US’.
Determines the format of the body of the response. Valid values are: audio/amr audio/amr-wb audio/x-wav The default format is audio/amr-wb.
A meta parameter to define multiple parameters within a single HTTP header.

member.name: M:ATT_MSSDK.RequestFactory.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{ATT_MSSDK.RequestFactory.ScopeTypes},System.String,System.String,ATT_MSSDK.ITokenCache,ATT_MSSDK.IHttp)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RequestFactory class. If application creates and uses multiple instances of Request Factory, then aplication should use this constructor to create Request Factory instance. This constructor takes the filepath passed as parameter to store/load the access token. So instead of each RequestFactory instance getting its own access token, access token saved/loaded from the file will be reused.
member.param: The End Point URL. This defaults to https://api.att.com.
The client id of your application.
The client secret of your application.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RequestFactory class. If application creates and uses multiple instances of Request Factory, then aplication should use this constructor to create Request Factory instance. This constructor takes the filepath passed as parameter to store/load the access token. So instead of each RequestFactory instance getting its own access token, access token saved/loaded from the file will be reused.
member.param: The End Point URL. This defaults to https://api.att.com.
The client id of your application.
The client secret of your application.
One or more values from SMS, MMS, SPEECH etc.
The URL for the OAuth redirect. Required if scopes include Terminal Location or Device Capabilities
The URL and Port number of your proxy, if you have one. For example: http://proxy:8888.
The filepath for saving/loading the access token. RequestFactory instance loads and saves the access token in this file.
member.exception: Thrown if the arguments are incorrect.
Thrown if an argument is unexpectedly null.

member.name: M:ATT_MSSDK.RequestFactory.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{ATT_MSSDK.RequestFactory.ScopeTypes},System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RequestFactory class. Takes an additional parameter 'timeout'. This overloaded constructor can be used by the application, if the application wants to set 'HttpWebRequest.Timeout' property for WebRequests to be done by RequestFactory. In this case, timeout value in milliseconds passed through constructor will be used by RequestFactory to set 'HttpWebRequest.Timeout' property when RequestFactory creates WebRequest. If this constructor is not used then RequestFactory will not set 'HttpWebRequest.Timeout' property during creation of WebRequest, resulting in default behaviour of 'HttpWebRequest.Timeout' property.
member.param: The End Point URL. This defaults to https://api.att.com.
The client id of your application.
The client secret of your application.
One or more values from SMS, MMS, SPEECH etc.
The URL for the OAuth redirect. Required if scopes include Terminal Location or Device Capabilities
The URL and Port number of your proxy, if you have one. For example: http://proxy:8888.
Timeout value in milliseconds to be used by request factory for setting HttpWebRequest.timeout property while invoking HttpWebRequest For example:5000.
member.exception: Thrown if the arguments are incorrect.
Thrown if an argument is unexpectedly null.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NBest class.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.NBest.Confidence
member.summary: Gets or sets the Confidence. The confidence value of the Hypothesis, a value between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.NBest.Hypothesis
member.summary: Gets or sets the Hypothesis. The transcription of the audio.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.NBest.LanguageId
member.summary: Gets or sets the LanguageId. The language used to decode the Hypothesis. Represented using the two-letter ISO 639 language code, hyphen, two-letter ISO 3166 country code in lower case, e.g. “en-us”.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.NBest.Grade
member.summary: Gets or sets the Grade. A machine-readable string indicating an assessment of utterance/result quality and the recommended treatment of the Hypothesis. The assessment reflects a confidence region based on prior experience with similar results. accept - the hypothesis value has acceptable confidence confirm - the hypothesis should be independently confirmed due to lower confidence reject - the hypothesis should be rejected due to low confidence

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.NBest.ResultText
member.summary: Gets or sets the ResultText. A text string prepared according to the output domain of the application package. The string will generally be a formatted version of the hypothesis, but the words may have been altered through insertions/deletions/substitutions to make the result more readable or usable for the client.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.NBest.Words
member.summary: Gets or sets the Words. List of strings The words of the Hypothesis split into separate strings. May omit some of the words of the Hypothesis string, and can be empty. Never contains words not in hypothesis string.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.NBest.WordScores
member.summary: Gets or sets the Words. List of numbers The confidence scores for each of the strings in the words array. Each value ranges from 0.0 to 1.0 inclusive.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ClientApp. The application name.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.ClientVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the ClientVersion. A version id for the app.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.ClientScreen
member.summary: Gets or sets the ClientScreen. A string representing the application's focus UI screen/widget for this request.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.ClientSdk
member.summary: Gets or sets the ClientSdk. The syntax for the parameter is library-platform-version

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.DeviceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the DeviceType. The device name, preferably from a standard API on the device itself (e.g. "iPhone4,1", "SGHT999", "SAMSUNG-SGH-I897", etc.)

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.DeviceOs
member.summary: Gets or sets the DeviceOs. The version string of the OS for the device type, preferably from a standard API on the device or autofilled by an SDK.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.DeviceTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the DeviceTime. The local device time at the time of the request. Format "YYYY-MMDD< space>HH:MM:SS<space>TZ".

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.ShowWordTokens
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of ShowWordTokens. Control output detail. If the packages have formatting applied to the ResultText field, this flag generates additional detail to show the named entities and the words from which those entities were derived. If no formatting is applied the output still shows the derivation from the spoken Hypothesis field, but the correspondence is one-to-one with the ResultText.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the ContentLanguage. For Generic Context only. Specifies the language of the submitted audio with one of the following two choices: ‘en-US’ (English - United States) and ‘es-US’ (Spanish - United States). If Content-Language is not specified, the default will be en-us.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.Microphone
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of Microphone. Specifies the acoustic model to be used during processing with one of the following two choices: ‘smartphone’ and ‘farfield’

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.HasMultipleNBest
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of HasMultipleNBest. Specifies whether multiple NBest elements should be returned with output parameters. • 'true' - Send multiple NBest elements • 'false' - Send a single NBest element Default value is false.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.PunctuateFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of PunctuateFlag. Gaming Chat sub-context only. Only for en-US output. Default value is true. Automatic Punctuation. “true” for On and “false” for Off to disable the automatic punctuation of the text in the JSON ResultText.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.XArgs.FormatFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of FormatFlag. Gaming Chat sub-context only. Only for en-US output. Default value is true. Automatic text formatting (for example, numbers, times, and so forth) “true” for On and “false” for Off to disable the automatic formatting markup of the text in the JSON ResultText. Only

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.TVXArgs.DeviceId
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of DeviceId. The device identifier should be an anonymized hash string identifying the device with a high likelihood of uniqueness while not providing any identifiable string or algorithmic method of recovering the original unique device identifier (UDID).

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.TVXArgs.NumResults
member.summary: Gets or sets the vlaue of NumResults. The size of the results returned is capped by this number. Use this parameter to limit the size of the returned program list.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.TVXArgs.PageRequest
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of PageRequest. Used to guide response messages and select next or previous page of partial search results. Use with “ResultKeys - FirstResultKey and LastResultKey” to get next or previous results. Valid values are: next or prev.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.TVXArgs.FirstResultKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of FirstResultKey. Used with “prev” option to identify the first result from the previous response. The response will include search items from before this response.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.TVXArgs.LastResultKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of LastResultKey. Used with “next” Page-Request option to get next results. This string identifies the last result the user saw in the previous response.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.SocialMediaXArgs.CommandPrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of CommandPrefix. This parameter customizes the recognition by selecting a preconfigured recognition context. For some applications, phrases may include common command-like prefixes like “update twitter” or “facebook”. If you expect end-users to include these prefixes, use the “CommandPrefix=true”. Default: false

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.SocialMediaXArgs.BrevityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of BrevityLevel Control for automatic text abbreviation behavior. This setting controls abbreviation of the output for things like “LOL”. “0” disables abbreviations. Higher numbers are more aggressive, meaning it will use less common abbreviations. Default: 0

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.Speechv3.SocialMediaXArgs.SocialSites

member.name: T:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities
member.summary: Capabilities object is returned as part of Device %Capabilities AT&T's API The Device %Capabilities attributes, which include Name, Vendor, Model, Release, UaProf, MMSCapable, AGPS, Location, Browser Name, Browser Type and WAP Push to allow developers to deliver applications that are tailored to a specific customer device.

member.name: M:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Capabilities class.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets Name AT&T's abbreviated code for the mobile device manufacturer and model number. These may or may not correspond to the device manufacturer's name and model number provided in the href. Note: The values manufacturer and model number will be separated by single SPACE

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.Vendor
member.summary: Gets or sets Vendor AT&T's abbreviated code for the mobile device manufacturer. This may or may not correspond to the device manufacturer's name provided in the uaprof.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.Model
member.summary: Gets or sets Model AT&T's model number for the mobile device. This may or may not correspond to the mobile device manufacturer's model number provided in the uaprof.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.FirmwareVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets FirmwareVersion AT&T's shall map the AT&T's specific device firmware release number (if available) to this parameter. This may or may not correspond to the mobile device manufacturer's firmware release numbers.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.UaProf
member.summary: Gets or sets UaProf Contains a URL to the device manufacturer website which may provide specific capability details for the mobile device in the request.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.MmsCapable
member.summary: Gets or sets MmsCapable Value indicates whether device is MMS capable “Y” or “N” ?

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.AssistedGps
member.summary: Gets or sets AssistedGps Value indicates whether device is assisted-GPS capable “Y” or “N”.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.LocationTechnology
member.summary: Gets or sets LocationTechnology Value indicates location technology network supported by device in terms of network Location service technology types i.e. “SUPL” or “SUPL2” as supporting Location query on 3G devices and 4G (LTE) devices respectively.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.DeviceBrowser
member.summary: Gets or sets DeviceBrowser Value indicates the name of the browser that is resident on the device e.g. “RIM” for Blackberry devices.

member.name: P:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.Capabilities.WapPushCapable
member.summary: Gets or sets WapPushCapable Value indicates whether device is WAP Push capable “Y” or “N”?

member.name: T:ATT_MSSDK.DeviceCapabilitiesv2.DeviceCapabilities
member.summary: This object is used to return the Device %Capabilities details from the network for a particular mobile terminal.
member.remarks: This class returns two categories of data, device ID and a set of capabilities. AT&T's implementation of the Device %Capabilities API service provides the user with device information that is specific to AT&T's network and device naming conventions. This method only yields proper results for AT&T supported devices. The results may not be accurate with devices when the subscriber is using an AT&T SIM with a device from other carriers.
